block.p: Heather Lynne Kaye, the daughter of Linda and Lester Kaye of Southampton, N.Y., was married yesterday to Ross Trevor Nussbaum, a son of Anita Frankel of Manhattan and Paul Nussbaum of Dallas. Justice Albert Tomei of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn officiated at the Essex House in Manhattan.

Mrs. Nussbaum, 27, is an advertising copywriter at Bloomingdale's in Manhattan. She graduated from Rollins College. Her father, who is retired, owned Kaye Chevrolet, a former automobile dealership in East Meadow, N.Y. Her mother is a trustee of Win for the Kids, a charity in West Palm Beach, Fla.

Heather Lynne Kaye, the daughter of Linda and Lester Kaye of Southampton, N.Y., was married yesterday to Ross Trevor Nussbaum, a son of Anita Frankel of Manhattan and Paul Nussbaum of Dallas. Justice Albert Tomei of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn officiated at the Essex House in Manhattan.

Mrs. Nussbaum, 27, is an advertising copywriter at Bloomingdale's in Manhattan. She graduated from Rollins College. Her father, who is retired, owned Kaye Chevrolet, a former automobile dealership in East Meadow, N.Y. Her mother is a trustee of Win for the Kids, a charity in West Palm Beach, Fla.

Mr. Nussbaum, 27, is a research analyst in the real estate investment trust group at Salomon Smith Barney in Manhattan. He graduated cum laude from Colby College and received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania. His mother owns ANF Travel, an agency in Manhattan. His father, who retired as the chairman and chief executive of Wyndham International, the hotel company, in Dallas, is now the chairman of the Sterling Media Capital Group, an asset management group for the media, communications and financial services industries, in Dallas.
